document.masterDocTitle: Ctenodontina Enderlein, 1914 (Diptera, Asilidae, Asilinae): new combinations, synonyms, new species and new records for Argentina

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Ctenodontina Enderlein, 1914 (Diptera, Asilidae, Asilinae): new combinations, synonyms, new species and new records for Argentina

subSubSection.paragraph: Addenda to the holotype original description based on specimens from Venezuela.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comments.
Ctenodontina baleta (Walker)
comb. nov.
,
Pachychoeta caracasae Martin
syn. nov.
and
Pachychoeta inca Martin
syn. nov.
were allocated in
Lecania Macquart. However
, these species have diagnostic characters of
Ctenodontina
.
Lecania
is a paraphyletic group and has no diagnostic characters defined. According to Artigas & Papavero (1995) ,
Lecania
“is an extremely varied assembly of species. This group needs a thorough revision to decide whether there are several genera involved or only one. The variation of the several characters is amazing, and there is an incredible combination of them”.

Ctenodontina baleta (Walker)
comb. nov.
,
P. caracasae Martin
syn. nov.
,
P. inca Martin
syn. nov.
as well as
C. nairae
and
C. martini
, do not have a spinous swelling ventrally on male hind femora ( Figs. 6, 7 ). However, as discussed by Fisher (1985) and Vieira (2012b) ,
Ctenodontina
is better defined by its very distinctive male and female terminalia and
C. baleta (Walker)
comb. nov.
,
P. caracasae Martin
syn. nov.
and
P. inca Martin
syn. nov.
by the following characters: female ovipositor with an apical comb of spines, and tergite VIII broadly expanded laterally, densely setose and cupped beneath, completely obscuring sternite VIII in profile and male specimens with an epandrium narrowed apically (usually terminating in a finger-like lobe), distinctly shorter than sternite VIII ( Fisher & Hespenheide 1992 ; Fisher 2009 ; Vieira 2012b ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 42–47 .
Ctenodontina
baleta
(Walker)
. comb. nov. 42. Gonocoxite and gonostylus; 43. Gonostylus and inner margin of gonocoxite; 44. Aedeagus; 45. Habitus female; 46. Ovipositor, dorsal view; 47. Ovipositor, ventral view. Abbreviations: aed: aedeagus; cerc: cercus; ej apod: ejaculatory apodeme; goncx: gonocoxite; goncx apod: gonocoxal apodeme; gonst: gonostylus; tg VIII: tergite VIII; tg IX+X: tergite IX+X.
